item.title: Patients suffer as intern doctors continue work stoppage at Osmani Hospital
item.description: Patients at Sylhet MAG Osmani Medical College Hospital are facing severe difficulties as intern doctors continue a work stoppage following an attack on a female intern doctor. Intern doctors at the hospital have been on strike for 24 consecutive hours after failing to reach an agreement with the a

item.title: Dhaka University Cultural Society welcomes new 'Oitri' batch
item.description: The Dhaka University Cultural Society held its annual reception programme 'Oitri Baran' on Thursday at the TSC Auditorium, welcoming its newest batch of members with an evening of performances that stretched from 2 pm well into the night. The event brought together students, faculty, and notable c

item.title: BUET Entrepreneurs Network launches BUETEN Summit 2026
item.description: The BUET Entrepreneurs Network (BUETEN) has announced its flagship event, the BUETEN Summit 2026, to be held on January 23 and 24 at the Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET) campus in Dhaka. Organised under the tagline "Connect. Innovate. Lead.", the summit will bring together

item.title: Two killed in Tangail road accident
item.description: Two people were killed and two others injured in a road accident at Basail upazila of Tangail district last evening. The deceased were identified as Milon, 24, son of Mintu Mia of Gosai Joyair area under Tangail Sadar upazila, and Arfan Khan, 75, son of late Moksed Khan of Chakpara area under Basa

item.title: Jamaat leaders set to meet CA Yunus on Sunday
item.description: Jamaat-e-Islami chief Shafiqur Rahman is scheduled to meet Chief Advisor Muhammad Yunus on Sunday. A five-member delegation led by Shafiqur will hold the meeting with Yunus at the State Guest House Jamuna in the evening, according to a senior official at the Chief Advisor’s Office. The me

item.title: Six die in Karachi shopping mall fire
item.description: At least six people have been killed in a massive fire that erupted at the Gul Plaza shopping mall in Pakistan’s Karachi, bdnews24.com reported citing Dawn. The Pakistani newspaper said the operation to put out the blaze is still underway hours after it sparked. On Sunday morning, South Dep

item.title: Man arrested for ‘killing’ seven-year old daughter in Sherpur
item.description: A father allegedly strangled his daughter to death at Char Basanti Purba Para village of Nakla upazila of Sherpur on Sunday. The deceased was Morium, 7, daughter of Babu Mia. His another daughter, Mim Akter, aged three and a half years, was admitted to Sherpur District Hospital with injuries on n

item.title: Police not protectors of any political party: Home adviser
item.description: Home Affairs Adviser Lieutenant General (retd) Md Jahangir Alam Chowdhury on Sunday said the police are not protectors of any political party, as they are state employees funded by taxpayers’ money. He emphasised that the primary responsibility of the police force is to serve the people and

item.title: Minor boy killed in Jatrabari road crash
item.description: An 11-year-old boy was killed when a truck ran over him in the Jatrabari area of Dhaka on Sunday. The deceased was identified as Md Zahid, 11, reports UNB. Inspector Md Faruk, in charge of Dhaka Medical College and Hospital (DMCH) police camp, said the accident occurred around 12:30 am when the t

item.title: Strong demand for cancellation of draft energy–power master plan
item.description: Civil society organisations have strongly objected to the interim government’s 25-year “Energy & Power Sector Master Plan (EPSMP): 2026-2050”. At a press conference held on Sunday at the Dhaka Reporters Unity (DRU) auditorium, speakers demanded the immediate suspension and comple

item.title: Govt clarifies CA’s support for ‘Yes’ vote in referendum
item.description: The interim government today (Sunday) clarified the Chief Adviser's support for the "Yes" vote in the forthcoming referendum is consistent with democratic norms in Bangladesh, outlining six major points in favour of the government's stance. item.title: Govt releases list of 80 vaccination centres for Hajj pilgrims
item.description: The Ministry of Religious Affairs has published a list of 80 vaccination centres in the country for Hajj pilgrims to receive the required vaccines.
